translated: Elder’s Birth Stories
The Chapter with Subhūti

analyzed: ut ti ya t theḥ a padāna
translated: The Elder Uttiya’s Birth Story
“On the bank of the Candabhāgā River,
I was a good-looking man then;

analyzed: sa gocara ppa su ta uha
translated: I was devoted to my own domain,
I went to a riverbank.

analyzed: siddhatthaḥ tamhi samaye  sayambhū agga puggalaḥ
translated: At that time, the One with Hair Tresses,🔽the Self-Existent One, the Foremost Person,
Desiring to cross the river,
he approached the riverbank.
When the Fully Enlightened One arrived,
I too went there;
Having approached the Fully Enlightened One,🔽I spoke these words:
‘Ascend, Great Hero,
I will ferry you across;
My domain is in the past,
have compassion, Great Sage.’
Having heard my cry,
the Great Sage ascended;
With an elated mind,🔽I ferried across the Leader of the World.
On the far bank of the river,
the One with Hair Tresses, the Leader of the World,
Comforted me there,
‘You will attain the Deathless.’
Having passed away from that body,
I went to the world of the gods;
I experienced divine bliss,
surrounded by sugar lumps.
Seven times I was the Lord of the Gods,
I reigned as king of the gods;
Three times I was a universal monarch,
a lord over the great earth.
I was devoted to solitude,
alert and well-controlled;
I bear my last body
in the Dispensation of the Buddha.
For ninety-four aeons
I have remembered that bull among men;
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of my rescue.
The four analytical knowledges,
and the eight liberations as well,
the six super-knowledges have been experienced,

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā uttiyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam āyasmai uttiyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: the Buddha’s Dispensation has been done.”🔽Thus has the venerable Elder Uttiya recited these verses.
The Elder Uttiya’s Portion is the eighth.
